subject: RE: M365 migration
preview: Hi Tony, Regarding the SPF records, our IP's are not included from what I can see (we don't have DNS access). And yes, absolutely, I'll be happy to get this sorted on Friday with you. We have found a

full_threads.body:
Hi Tony, 

Regarding the SPF records, our IP's are not included from what I can see (we don't have DNS access). And yes, absolutely, I'll be happy to get this sorted on Friday with you. We have found a couple of interesting quirks, it will be great to tie up this loose end as well. FYI the submissions are being saved in the WordPress admin as a fail safe.

Hi Heath,

Is this relying on SPF? If so then it should continue to work as the SPF records will remain the same. We're cutting over on Friday morning at 8.30am - if we have issues, can we contact you to help troubleshoot if required and/or switch email auth mechanism on the form?

Cheers,

Tony

[url=atarix.com.au]

Tony Tran

Principal Consultant

T: +612 9160 4554 | M: +61422 353 171 | 1300 ATARIX

E: tony.tran@atarix.com.au

Level 7, 48 Hunter St, Sydney, NSW 2000 | atarix.com.au

[url=linkedin.com/company/atarix/] [url=facebook.com/AtarixConsulting/] [url=instagram.com/atarix_consulting/]

Hi Tony, 

Sure, it's set to noreply@stellainsurance.com.au, but this is aliased and not authenticated. If the emails are coming through now, it's highly likely that they will continue to do so. 

Let me know? Alternatively, we can send via an SMTP, which tends to be safer.

Hi Heath,

What's the sender's address on these forms? If it's not using a stellainsurance.com.au address, then we can do nothing for the upcoming migration change, then address separately if needed.

Thanks,
Tony

[url=atarix.com.au]

Tony Tran

Principal Consultant

T: +612 9160 4554 | M: +61422 353 171 | 1300 ATARIX

E: tony.tran@atarix.com.au

Level 7, 48 Hunter St, Sydney, NSW 2000 | atarix.com.au

[url=linkedin.com/company/atarix/] [url=facebook.com/AtarixConsulting/] [url=instagram.com/atarix_consulting/]

Hi Sahil, 

They are being sent to hello@stellainsurance.com.au. They were previously being sent to the old developer's email address by the looks of it. 

Can we please verify that they are coming through?

Thanks Heath,

Can you please confirm to what email address are these being sent to at the moment? Is it hello@stellainsurance.com.au or help@stellainsurance.com.au?

Thanks,

Sahil Tulsiani

Chief Information Officer

M 0403 022 359

E sahil@envest.com.au

A Level 15, 50 Pitt Street, Sydney NSW 2000.

W http://www.envest.com.au/

Hi Renee and Tony, 

The website form submissions are sent using the PHP mail function by WordPress. If desired, we can configure the website to send via SMTP, we will just need the credentials. 

Let me know if we can help in any way.

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Are you able to have a look into the below for us?

Thanks,
Renee

Subject: RE: M365 migration


Hi Mike,


Do you know how the website contact form works and what mechanism it uses to send/receive emails on this page https://www.stellainsurance.com.au/contact/? Wondering if it is using SMTP to auth to an O365 mailbox or plugin to some other platform?

Thanks,

Tony

Hi Mike,

That's perfect. Exactly the info we needed.

We have some post migration testing steps to ensure these integrations are working as expected. Is it OK to loop yourself in as a testing/validation contact or should we include another contact?

Thanks,

Tony

From: Mike Scott <mike@aventusplatform.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 16, 2021 7:45:08 PM
To: Tony Tran <tony.tran@atarix.com.au>
Cc: Sahil Tulsiani <Sahil@envest.com.au>; David Barnes - Aventus <david@aventusplatform.com>; Alex Cortes <alex@edagroup.com.au>; Elisa Richards <elisa.richards@atarix.com.au>
Subject: Re: M365 migration

Further update: Stella has a couple of email addresses configured in Salesforce using their "email-to-case" functionality. This enables the management of inbound email via Salesforce's case management.

The following email addresses are configured in the existing system to forward email to salesforce (forwarding address in brackets):

  • hello@stellainsurance.com.au (hello@2q6wfnfjxxg87eyyhunbcmo861jlrs6xjydnvuwgnwgipvhp5u.2v-2iccpeaw.ap20.case.salesforce.com)
  • help@stellainsurance.com.au (help@g-32odvpu4q92aty5hcsan7oveix2o3hue6e5jkejmzsl6gidazc.2v-2iccpeaw.ap20.case.salesforce.com)

These will need to be configured for forwarding in the new system. I think the current setup used Mimecast to facilitate this forwarding as occasionally the team would see quarantine notification emails from that service. Not sure if that's still active in this new configuration but one to be aware of.


Cheers,

Mike


---

Mike Scott
Engineering Manager
Aventus

E: mike@aventusplatform.com
W: www.aventusplatform.com

On Tue, 16 Nov 2021 at 07:16, Mike Scott <mike@aventusplatform.com> wrote:

Hi Sahil, Tony,

My apologies for not getting back to you sooner. DNS records that Aventus require/setup are recorded here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1fspiipTBG0yjnXQRGWoQOoCdTKNpTgccQKUmkvrtTDM/edit#gid=0

These records exclude marketing website details (these are now managed by yourself) and do not include records/configuration for Active Campaign (I'm not sure what is required for that configuration).

Three main services are in use to deliver email right now for Aventus-managed services:

  • Postmark - used for the delivery of transactional email by our platform. This is authenticated by bounce subdomain and domain key records.
  • Salesforce - delivers email directly for support/sales-related activities. Authenticated by domain key and SPF records
  • Pardot - delivers automated marketing email (to be replaced by Active Campaign soon). Authenticated by domain key and SPF records

There is no direct authentication with M365. So long as the above DNS records persist then everything should be fine.

As your change is in 2 days, I'll make sure that is recorded in our on-call notes and we keep an eye out, please keep us updated on activities and we can do any required testing.

Cheers,

Mike


---

Mike Scott
Engineering Manager
Aventus

E: mike@aventusplatform.com
W: www.aventusplatform.com

Hi Mike,


As mentioned by Sahil, we'll be cutting over Stella's O365 to a new environment, which means any previously used SMTP accounts integrated to Aventus will change.

For outbound emails, do you rely on SPF to send as stellainsurance.com.au or do you authenticate to the mailboxes directly to then send emails?


Happy to jump on a call to confirm tomorrow as the change is occurring in 2 days.

Thanks,
Tony

Hope all's well. Hear that digital underwriting is close? Can't wait to have a look!

Just wanted to let you know that we are looking to cut Stella across into the Envest Microsoft tenancy next week. Just looking to understand what you would need to ensure that outbound email services continue.

If required, we can jump on a call Monday next week.

Thanks,
